Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • Game

  • public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
    The Game class is used to maintain each game that is played. It contains all the functionality required to play interact with the game state.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Game(Difficulty diff)
      Game constructor generates a game based on the difficulty selected in the Options class, stores its solutions and initialises its history.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean finished()
      Determines if the game is finished by checking that every tile is correct.
      Board getBoard()
      Gets the board that is being played on.
      int getCorrectValue(int x, int y)
      Gets the correct value of the given coordinate.
      Difficulty getDifficulty()
      Get the difficulty of this game
      boolean getHint()
      Get a hint for the current game state.
      void makeMove(Move m)
      Makes a move in the game.
      void redoMove()
      Redo a move if it can be done.
      void undoMove()
      Undo a move if it can be done.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Game

        public Game(Difficulty diff)
        Game constructor generates a game based on the difficulty selected in the Options class, stores its solutions and initialises its history.

    • Method Detail

      • getBoard

        public Board getBoard()
        Gets the board that is being played on.
        Returns:
        the board used by this game to play on.

      • getDifficulty

        public Difficulty getDifficulty()
        Get the difficulty of this game
        Returns:
        the difficulty of the game

      • makeMove

        public void makeMove(Move m)
        Makes a move in the game. Checks are done in order to avoid equal moves to be made, the history of the game is updated, and the display is updated if necessary.
        Parameters:
        m - The move to be made

      • undoMove

        public void undoMove()
        Undo a move if it can be done.

      • redoMove

        public void redoMove()
        Redo a move if it can be done.

      • getHint

        public boolean getHint()
        Get a hint for the current game state.
        Returns:
        a tile to be hinted at.

      • getCorrectValue

        public int getCorrectValue(int x,
                  int y)
        Gets the correct value of the given coordinate.
        Parameters:
        x - The x coordinate of the sudoku grid
        y - The y coordinate of the sudoku grid
        Returns:
        The correct value of the give coordinate

      • finished

        public boolean finished()
        Determines if the game is finished by checking that every tile is correct.
        Returns:
        true if the game is finished with the correct solution
